byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from Paris, Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran, and Musikilu Mojeed from Abuja, Nigeria.

abstract: Shiite sect in Nigeria alleges that military massacred hundreds of its members; government disputes death toll, acknowledging that at least seven members were killed.
lead_paragraph: The sect said the military killed hundreds of its members over the weekend, though the government disputed the death toll and said the sect threatened a military convoy.

headline.main: Shiite Muslim Sect Alleges Massacre by Nigeria’s Military
headline.print_headline: Shiite Sect Alleges That Nigeria’s Military Massacred Hundreds of Members

snippet: The sect said the military killed hundreds of its members over the weekend, though the government disputed the death toll and said the sect threatened a military convoy.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
